text: Grevillea obtusifolia, the obtuse-leaved grevillea, is a shrub which is endemic to the south-west of Western Australia. It grows up to between 0.5 and 1.5 metres in height and up to 5 metres in width. It produces pink to red flowers between August and November (mid winter to late spring ) in its native range. The species was first formally described by botanist Carl Meissner, his description published in Prodromus Systematis Naturalis Regni Vegetabilis in 1856. ==References== * * * obtusifolia Category:Endemic flora of Western Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Taxa named by Carl Meissner
title: Grevillea obtusifolia
